intro: Senecio toumeyi, commonly known as the St. Augustine daisy, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble daisies. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and has a mat-forming growth habit with hairy, narrow leaves. Its yellow disk flowers are surrounded by white ray florets, and it produces small, oblong fruits. Senecio toumeyi is often used in gardens for its ornamental value and drought tolerance.
